# Contributing to Lazorkit Mobile Wallet Example

Thank you for your interest in contributing to this project! This starter template is designed to help developers learn Lazorkit SDK integration.

## How to Contribute

### Reporting Issues

- Check existing issues before creating a new one
- Provide detailed reproduction steps
- Include your environment details (OS, Node version, Expo version)
- Share error logs and screenshots if applicable

### Suggesting Features

- Open an issue with the "enhancement" label
- Explain the use case and how it demonstrates Lazorkit integration
- Consider if the feature aligns with the bounty requirements

### Submitting Pull Requests

1. Fork the repository
2. Create a feature branch: `git checkout -b feature/your-feature-name`
3. Make your changes with clear commit messages
4. Test thoroughly on both iOS and Android
5. Update documentation if needed
6. Submit a PR with a detailed description

### Code Guidelines

- Follow TypeScript best practices
- Add comments for complex Lazorkit SDK interactions
- Use meaningful variable names
- Keep components focused and reusable
- Test on physical devices for biometric features

### Documentation

- Update README if adding new features
- Add tutorial sections for complex integrations
- Include code comments explaining Lazorkit-specific logic

## Development Setup

```bash
git clone https://github.com/yourusername/lazorkit-mobile-wallet.git
cd lazorkit-mobile-wallet
npm install
npm start
```

## Testing Checklist

- [ ] Works on iOS physical device
- [ ] Works on Android physical device
- [ ] Passkey authentication functions correctly
- [ ] Gasless swaps execute without errors
- [ ] Balances update after transactions
- [ ] All error states are handled gracefully

## Questions?

Join the Lazorkit Telegram: https://t.me/lazorkit
